message: Truly humbled to take the Oath of Office for another term as your Congressman.  Thank you for trusting me to be your voice in the U.S. House.  We are a strong people and our nation will endure the difficult days ahead...as long as we stand up and keep fighting for what we believe in.  I hope you will stand with me.

The Republicans don't have a plan to repeal and replace Obamacare, all they have is a tweet.  I agree with the American Medical Association, we can't turn our backs on the 20M Americans who have coverage under the AC A and the 185 million who are now better protected under private health insurance because of this historic law.
Stop vigilante censorship, let's defend the 1st Amendment.

From the beginning, this has really been about just two simple things...standing up for my 18-year old constituent, and defending the 1st Amendment.  This painting, like the 400+ other entries, was accepted and approved by the Congressional Art Competition and it has been peacefully displayed in a public forum for more than six months.  I am not going to accept vigilante censorship...I hope you won't either.  The 1st Amendment means what it says.
NA
You can be sure that I will appeal this unprecedented and unconstitutional suppression of the 1st Amendment guarantee of freedom of expression.
The Affordable Care Act is worth fighting for.  The Republican plan to repeal it with no replacement will cost lives, explode the deficit and make America sick again.
From the Washington Post editorial page...because the 1st Amendment is worth fighting for.
NA
NA
Wonderful words of faith, compassion and humanity from St. Louis Archbishop Robert Carlson - "Be kind to the stranger."
Our faith traditions compel us to be kind to the stranger.

President Trump’s Muslim travel ban and complete ban on admitting refugees is not only illegal, it’s un-American, mean-spirited, and will harm national security.  We will defend and welcome refugees, we will resist discrimination based on religion and national origin, and we will demand equal treatment under the law for all.  Since the 9-11 attacks, there has not been a single instance where a refugee admitted to the United States committed a terrorist attack.  Those are the facts, and the vetting process, which takes almost two years, is already very strict.   It works.  Besides violating the Constitution, this Executive Order will weaken the United States across the world by giving aid, comfort and increased motivation to jihadist extremists who wish to do us harm.  We can’t have a President who acts without thinking about how his actions harm innocent people and violate who we are as Americans.  People of faith across this country are united in opposing this terrible, totally un-American action that violates the law and our core values.  Our faith compels us to be kind to the stranger, and to comfort the oppressed.  And as the leader of my church, Pope Francis, said just yesterday: “You cannot reject refugees and call yourself a Christian.
NA
Shameful assault on the environment and trampling on the rights of Native Americans for dirty oil that Americans don't need.
Ruling was unanimous and bipartisan.
Voting Rights are worth fighting for.

Speaker Ryan and House Republicans are refusing to investigate this obvious threat to our national security.  Let them know that we need to know the truth, the whole truth...right now....wherever that leads.

Why did the President allow this threat to remain at the heart of our national security team for 19-days?.  What prevented him from acting? This is not about politics anymore, it's about defending our democracy.  We need to come together to launch an independent, bipartisan investigation now...today, no more excuses.
"Congress must grow a spine and compel testimony under oath. Country comes before party."  - St. Louis Post-Dispatch editorial 2.15.17
Bipartisan, independent...time to put country ahead of party.
Because the 1st Amendment is worth fighting for.

Standing with my constituents and our wonderful St. Louis interfaith leadership to reject hate, condemn Antisemitism and repair the damage at the historic Chesed Shel Emeth cemetery in University City, MO.

You can't censor or suppress the free press, that's not what America is about.  This is an outrageous assault on the 1st Amendment. Democrats and Republicans who respect the Constitution need to stand together to oppose this.  The media is not the "enemy of the people."  They are the eyes and ears of an informed citizenry.
No more excuses or attempts to obstruct...time for a bipartisan, independent investigation.
Americans want Congress to strengthen consumer protection not gut it...I helped to create the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and I intend to fight to keep it.
Protecting polluters and making it harder to protect clean air and safe water will not make America great...it will put everyone at risk.  Wrong, reckless, irresponsible.,
The time for excuses and evasions is over. Too many unanswered questions, too many lies.  We must have an independent, bipartisan investigation that will follow the facts wherever they lead.

President Trump’s revised Muslim travel ban is cruel, ineffective, and counterproductive to our national security.  It will do nothing to keep America safe but it will empower the extremists who wish to do us harm.    We must continue to welcome and defend refugees and immigrants without discriminating against them on the basis of their religion or country of origin.  And we will demand equal protection under the law for all, as required by the Constitution.  Since the 9-11 attacks, there has not been a single case where a refugee admitted to the United States committed a terrorist attack.  And this revised Muslim travel ban does not even cover the nations that produced the 9-11 terrorists. Those are the facts, and the refugee vetting process, which takes almost two years, is already very strict.   It works.  People of faith across this country are united in opposing this terrible, totally un-American action that violates our core values, contributes nothing to our national security, and emboldens extremism.
America's best constitutional scholars to help me fight for David Pulphus' 1st Amendment rights in federal court.
NA
Proud to stand up for full equality for LGBT citizens.  We won't take one step back!

Trumpcare is a train wreck.  After all of the Republicans’ hollow promises, the devastating reality of their cruel plan has been revealed.  It’s no wonder why they pushed this reckless and irresponsible mess forward in the middle of the night and are in such a huge rush to force this poisonous prescription down the throats of the American people.    Their bill would deprive 24 million Americans of their healthcare coverage while handing billionaires a deficit-busting tax break. And it will also significantly weaken Medicare and Medicaid.   Trumpcare will make America sicker, not stronger; and I will work tirelessly to defeat it.  Key Findings of the CBO Report  24 million Americans will lose their health coverage – including 14 million in 2018 alone.  301,000 individuals across Missouri who have gained coverage via the ACA could lose their coverage.  38,000 citizens in Missouri’s 1st CD could be stripped of their healthcare coverage.  225,878 individuals in Missouri who received financial assistance to purchase ACA Marketplace coverage in 2016, averaging $315 per individual, are at risk of having coverage become unaffordable under the Republican plan.  Women in the state who can now purchase insurance for the same price as men are at risk of being charged more for insurance if the Republican Congress eliminates the ACA’s ban on gender rating.  Under the GOP bill, 19 percent of the nonelderly population will be uninsured in 2026, compared to 10 percent in 2026 under current law…almost doubling the number of uninsured Americans.  The bill would have the effect of slashing Medicaid by $880 billion over the next 10 years.  Under the GOP bill, a 64-year-old with an income of $26,500 in the individual market will pay $12,900 more in their premiums each year.  By defunding Planned Parenthood for one year, the bill would have the result of many women losing access to care, including contraceptives and other family planning services.    The bill gives $600 billion in tax cuts to the wealthiest Americans and large corporations – including $2.8 billion to the 400 richest families in America alone.
Amazing new exhibit at the Missouri History Museum in St. Louis,,,time to tell the untold history of the fight for freedom.  Free.

A Muslim travel ban by any other name is still a Muslim travel ban.  It's wrong, it's offensive, it's un-American, and it emboldens extremists who wish to do us harm.  Suspending the refugee program makes no sense either.   We have a moral duty to welcome them and keep them safe. And the fact is, they make America stronger.

It's time for my 17th Annual Congressional Art Competition!  This is your chance to win a free trip to Washington, DC where your winning artwork will be unveiled as part of a public exhibit at the U.S. Capitol complex.  All high school artists who live in Missouri's 1st Congressional District are eligible.  Deadline for entries is May 3rd.  Please call (314) 669-9393 for more info.  Or email us at mo1stdistrict@gmail.com

Honored to speak on the House floor today in memory of an American musical legend, a St. Louis original, and a former neighbor and friend of the Clay family for six decades...the father of Rock n' Roll, Chuck Berry, who passed away last Saturday at the age of 90.  His musical genius is a jewel in the crown of St. Louis' rich musical heritage and his legacy and unique sound will continue to inspire artists and fans everywhere as long as we have Rock n' Roll.

The testimony of FBI Director Comey makes clear that we have no choice but to appoint a special counsel to conduct an independent investigation into Russian attempts to infiltrate and influence the 2016 presidential election, including whether associates of the President coordinated with them in any way.  The defense of our democracy requires nothing less.

Over 38,000 St. Louisans could lose their healthcare coverage if House Republicans repeal the Affordable Care Act.  They are among 24 million Americans who would be hurt by this despicable bill.  The vote is tomorrow, Call your Member of Congress in Missouri and tell them to vote NO.  The ACA saves lives.  Protect Our Care

Thanks to my great friend, former Vice President Joe Biden for rallying with us today to mark the 7th anniversary of the Affordable Care Act that is helping millions of Americans.  I fought hard to pass this bill, and tomorrow, I will fight hard to defend it against the despicable attempt by House Republicans to repeal it.  Over 200,000 Missourians could lose their healthcare coverage if the Affordable Care Act is repealed.  Call you Member of Congress today and tell them to vote NO.
This is no longer about political parties...it's about defending our democracy.  No choice now.  Congress must authorize an independent investigation immediately.
Thanks to everyone who stood strong with me against TrumpCare.
No other option...we need an independent investigation now...not another cover up.
The cover-up grows...it's obvious that the only option now is an independent investigation.  This is not about who won the election, this is about defending our democracy.
Like most Washington cover-ups, this one will ultimately fall apart.  We need an independent investigation without delay.
A clear link between Chairman Nunes, WH teaming up for a cover-up.  He needs to recuse himself and we need an independent investigation.

This Trump-Russia mess smells worse every day.  Turns out that even after President Obama expelled 35 Russian diplomats and imposed new sanctions on Putin & friends for assaulting our democratic process....this Blackwater guy, who happens to be the brother of Secretary of Education Betsy DeVoss, set up back channel communications between Trump and Putin.  Outrageous.  We need an independent investigation led by a special prosecutor now.

I helped create the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau as part of the landmark Dodd-Frank legislation which punished the worst abusive practices on Wall Street and within the financial services sector.  To date, the CFPB has returned over $29 billion to 12 million American consumers.  But House Republicans want to gut this agency.  The choice is clear...either you came to Washington to protect consumers, or you are here to protect someone else. Please help me protect the CFPB.

A budget is a statement of our national priorities...and one of my highest priorities has always been supporting child and maternal health.  It's shameful that President Trump does not share that commitment.

Here is a joint statement from my talented young constituent, David Pulphus, and myself...in response to the preliminary denial of an injunction regarding his award-winning painting:  “Our nation was founded on the very principle of freedom of speech, and there are few places where that core freedom warrants greater respect than the U.S. Capitol.  That is why we are confident that the U.S. Court of Appeals will eventually vindicate not only our legal rights, but those of the American people.  We believe our Constitution simply cannot tolerate a situation where artwork can be removed from the Capitol for the first time ever as a result of a series of ideologically and politically driven complaints.”
NA

By a huge margin, the American people want and deserve the whole truth about Trump/Russia. That can only be produced by an independent investigation.  But Republicans in Congress are still obstructing that.  What are they hiding?
Real leaders don't build walls...they build bridges.

60% of the American people want to keep ObamaCare and have Congress work to make it better...we should do that. But House Republicans just offered an Amendment to allow TrumpCare 2.0 to strip away protections for patients with preexisting conditions.  Real pain for millions of people...lives lost too. Please stand with me to stop this when they try to bring TrumpCare up for a vote again.

Proud to stand on the U.S. House floor today in defense of my talented young constituent from St. Louis, David Pulphus.  His 1st Amendment rights are worth fighting for.  Especially grateful to so many of my colleagues from around the country who joined me to defend free speech, here in the people's House.

Honored to nominate 13 exceptional young St. Louisans to attend our nation's military Service Academies.  They are academically gifted, community-oriented and ready to serve their country.  So proud of them.

100 days of broken promises, obstructing the truth about Trump/Russia, harming the environment, and trying to strip healthcare coverage away from 24 million Americans.  That's not making America great...but it is doing great harm.  We will resist.
“No parent should ever have to decide if they can afford to save their child’s life. It just shouldn’t happen. Not here.”

House Republicans are pushing for a vote on TrumpCare 2.0 tomorrow.  They are banking on a phony amendment to offer $8 billion to fund state-based, high-risk pools for the 131 million Americans who suffer from pre-existing conditions.  The states would need at least $200 billion to cover them.  TrumpCare 2.0 will cost lives.  Call your Member of Congress today and demand that they vote NO.

The dangerous reality of TrumpCare, which House Republicans approved today without even reading the bill or knowing what it will cost is simply this…24 million Americans will lose their healthcare coverage; guaranteed coverage for preexisting conditions will be eliminated; essential patient benefits will be lost; Medicaid will be devastated; and Medicare will be robbed of billions of dollars.  It’s no wonder why they were in a huge rush to push this poisonous prescription down the throats of the American people.  Make no mistake, TrumpCare will cost lives.  And every Republican who voted for it today will own this shameful betrayal of the American people forever.  History will judge them. So will the voters.”   TrumpCare’s Devastating Impact on Healthcare  in St. Louis and across the United States  • 24 million Americans will lose their health coverage – including 14 million in 2018 alone; • 38,000 citizens in Missouri’s 1st CD could be stripped of their healthcare coverage. • Guaranteed coverage for those patients with preexisting conditions is gone. • Essential patient benefits will be lost. • TrumpCare is opposed by the AARP, the American Medical Association, the American Cancer Society, the American Diabetes Association, the American Nurses Association and virtually every other group that represents healthcare providers and healthcare advocates. • Under the GOP bill, 19 percent of the nonelderly population will be uninsured in 2026, compared to 10 percent in 2026 under current law. • The bill would have the effect of slashing Medicaid by $880 billion over the next 10 years. • Under the GOP bill, a 64-year-old with an income of $26,500 in the individual market will pay $12,900 more in their premiums each year. • The bill gives $600 billion in tax cuts to the wealthiest Americans and large corporations – including $2.8 billion to the 400 richest families in America alone.

For 18-days, even after being warned repeatedly that his National Security Advisor, Mike Flynn, was vulnerable to blackmail by the Russians, Donald Trump allowed Flynn to remain on the job and to have access to our most sensitive national security secrets and to take part in conversations with the very same foreign adversaries who may have compromised him.  Outrageous national security failure and an indefensible tolerance of corruption in the White House.

Calling all job seekers...my Career Fair, St. Louis' biggest and best free jobs event is back on Monday, June 5th at Harris-Stowe State University.  Over 100 top companies, all of them are hiring, and they want to meet you.  For more information, call (314) 367-1970.
Donald Trump is not above the law.  Richard Nixon learned that hard lesson.  History repeating itself?

From "THE NEW YORKER" 5.10.17..."Until the White House comes up with a less ludicrous rationalization for its actions, we can only assume that Trump fired Comey because the Russia investigation is closing in on him and his associates, and he knew that he didn’t have much sway over the F.B.I. director. That is the simplest theory that fits the facts. And it is a cause for great alarm."
President Trump has a tortured relationship with the truth, not just with the American people, but with his own White House staff.  That's a real danger to our national security.

Comey took notes...Trump tried to obstruct justice.  Time for a special prosecutor, perhaps more. "The memo was part of a paper trail Mr. Comey created documenting what he perceived as the president’s improper efforts to influence a continuing investigation. An F.B.I. agent’s contemporaneous notes are widely held up in court as credible evidence of conversations."

The Oversight Committee, where I serve as a Senior Member, has invited former FBI Director James Comey to testify next Wednesday, and we have also demanded all tapes, records, transcripts and all other evidence regarding President Trump's conversations and communications with former Director Comey.  We will get to the truth.  The integrity of our democracy is at stake.

Last night, all 34 Democratic Members of the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform and the House Committee on the Judiciary sent a detailed letter to their respective Republican Chairmen outlining their demand for an immediate investigation into the actions of President Donald Trump, Attorney General Jeff Sessions, and top White House aides:   “We are writing to request that the Oversight Committee and the Judiciary Committee launch an immediate joint investigation into whether President Donald Trump and his top officials are engaged in an ongoing conspiracy to obstruct the criminal, counter-intelligence, and oversight investigations currently being conducted by the Federal Bureau of Investigation, the Department of Justice, and Congress into members of his presidential campaign and their contacts with Russian officials.”   The letter explains:   “Given the gravity of the events that have occurred over the past several weeks, there is simply no reasonable question that the Oversight Committee and Judiciary Committee should already be conducting a robust investigation of these issues that includes public hearings, document requests, and interviews and depositions.  It is unacceptable to continue ignoring these scandals.”   With respect to the Oversight Committee’s lack of action to date, the letter states:   “Although Chairman Chaffetz recently sent a letter to the Department of Justice Inspector General, we believe that response is anemic—especially for the Oversight Committee, which claims to be the premiere investigative body in the House of Representatives—and particularly in comparison to the multiple ‘emergency’ hearings he called and the unilateral subpoenas he issued as part of the investigation into former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton.”   With respect to the Judiciary Committee’s lack of action to date, the letter states:   “On several occasions—through at least four letters to Chairman Goodlatte, and in debate on three separate resolutions of inquiry debated in the Judiciary Committee—we have called for the Majority to take action ‘to ensure the integrity and independence of both the Department of Justice and the Federal Bureau of Investigation’.”   The Members conclude:   “We are concerned that the continued failure of House Republicans to take action in the face of this onslaught of allegations will cause significant damage to the faith that the American people have in the credibility and integrity of our Committees and the House of Representatives.  We have a solemn obligation under the Constitution to act as a check on the Executive Branch and to hold President Trump accountable.  It is time to do our job.”   The letter requests an immediate public hearing with Director Comey and copies of all of the FBI Director’s memos relating to the President, as well as all associated agency and White House records, including any audio tapes, and notes, if they exist.     The letter also requests that the Oversight Committee schedule an immediate vote on a motion to subpoena the White House to produce documents it has been withholding in response to the bipartisan request from Ranking Member Cummings and Chairman Chaffetz on March 22, 2017.  All Democratic Members of the Oversight Committee sent a letter to Chairman Chaffetz on April 27, 2017, insisting that he press the White House to produce these documents, but the Chairman refused to even hold a meeting. No better man to get to the whole truth about Trump/Russia and he will follow the facts wherever they lead him. Applause for Deputy AG Rosenstein for showing real courage.
The right man to get to the whole truth.  No one is above the law, not even the President.  This investigation is about affirming the integrity of our democracy.

The President of the United States told Russian officials in the Oval Office that he fired FBI Director James Comey because he was a "nut job" who was putting a lot of pressure on him.  Can you spell obstruction of justice?  Unbelievable.
Great news for minority voters across the country and a victory for everyone's voting rights.
Nixon would have been proud of this...unbelievable abuse of power...obstruction of justice.

Note to President Trump...cutting funding for life-saving cures, Medicaid, Medicare, nutrition and violence prevention will not "make America great again"...but it will punish seniors, the disabled, low-income Americans and at-risk children.  Your budget is a disaster for the American people and it is dead on arrival in Congress.

Over 100 top employers seeking to fill over 1,000 jobs, and it's all free. Only at my Career Fair, St. Louis' biggest and best free jobs event. Join me Monday, June 5th at Harris-Stowe State University, 9:30AM..and bring your resumes. For more information, please call (314) 367-1970 or go to www.lacyclay.house.gov

Congratulations to Santia Maderios, of McCluer High School, the 1st place winner of my 17th annual Congressional Art Competition.  Looking forward to hosting her in DC as we unveil her winning entry at the U.S. Capitol complex.  Talented young people have a 1st Amendment right to express themselves.  Their art is true to them, and they deserve to be celebrated.
Trump's budget would devastate vital human services provided by nonprofits to low and moderate income citizens, especially seniors.  We won't let that happen.

Boeing, Express Scripts, Charter Spectrum, Centene...just a few of the 100+ great companies who are trying to fill over 1,000 job openings at all levels...only at my Career Fair, St. Louis' biggest and best free jobs event.  Monday, June 5th, 9:30AM at Harris-Stowe State University.  Bring your resumes and get there early.  For more information, please call (314) 367-1970.

Wow...just one week until my Career Fair...St. Louis' biggest and best free jobs event!  Over 100 top companies have over 1,000 jobs to fill and they want to meet you! Join me Monday, June 5th at Harris-Stowe State University.  Doors open at 9:30AM, get there early, bring your resumes and dress for success.  For more information, please call (314) 367-1970

How many interviews are you going to line up at my Career Fair, next Monday, 9:30a.m. Harris-Stowe State University.  Over 100 companies seeking to fill over 1,000 job openings...and they want to meet you!  All free.  Get there early and bring your resume.  For more information, please call (314) 367-1970.

Opportunity is knocking...over 100 great employers seeking to fill over 1,000 job openings right now!  MONDAY, 9:30AM CDT at Harris-Stowe State University's Emerson Performance Center.  Your new job is waiting to meet you at my Career Fair.  For more info, please call (314) 367-1970
ST. LOUIS POST-DISPATCH EDITORIAL 6.6.17 "A tone-deaf, Twitter-obsessed president embarrasses his country.

Remembering and forever grateful for the bravery and courage of these brave men who began the liberation of Europe from Nazi Germany on D-Day, June 6, 1944. 73-years ago today. Thank you for saving the world.
Director Comey not only took notes on his conversations with President Trump, he has FBI witnesses to back him up.  Stayed tuned...the truth is coming closer.
The truth leads to one conclusion...obstruction of justice.

In the words of former Nixon staffer and Watergate investigation star witness John Dean: "Today we saw the tip of the iceberg."   The whole truth is coming closer.. Special Counsel Mueller will reveal the rest.  Two obvious conclusions from Director Comey's testimony... Trump lied, and he attempted to obstruct justice.
NA

"As one Republican aide put it to Axios on Monday, “We aren’t stupid.” Better to pass a terrible bill in the cover of darkness just as the House did with its version, the American Health Care Act, in the hopes that critics do not have much time to raise a stink."
NA
NA

Turning the clock back on civil rights enforcement won't make America great...but it will cause real pain for women, African Americans, Latinos, the disabled and new Americas.  They deserve better and the Constitution requires us to provide equal justice and protection for all...not just for some.

President Donald Trump is violating the foreign Emoluments Clause of the Constitution by profiting from foreign governments without the consent of Congress.  I joined with 195 of my colleagues in a lawsuit to force disclosure and a complete review of these constitutional violations.  Foreign governments have granted preliminary approval of trademarks, paid to stay at Trump hotels, and are leasing space at Trump properties.  President Trump continues to prioritize his business interests – and the interests of the foreign governments who give him money – over the interests of the American people.   We cannot trust Trump to put the American people first when he’s getting cash and benefits from the rest of the world.  Right now, the American people are in the dark. Americans deserve to know if President Trump is making policy decisions for his own financial benefit. American jobs and national security are at risk.  There is a complete lack of transparency by the Administration or any form of oversight by the Majority in Congress. House Democrats have sent numerous letters to President Trump that have gone unanswered concerning payments he received from foreign governments.  Congress has no choice but to ask our courts to step in to uphold our Constitution.

A foreign adversary launched an attack on our democracy.  That is a threat which every American, regardless of party, should be alarmed about.  We must  take urgent, bipartisan action to stop this from happening again.
If any CEO in America said this about any woman...he would be fired.   Beyond disbelief...he continually demeans his own office.

In memory of the victims of the East St. Louis Race Riots..terrible violence that cost the lives of hundreds of innocent African Americans,100-years ago.  Hate is a powerful poison that we should not inject into our politics, our country and especially in our communities.  Remember, never forget, never again.

The Senate version of TrumpCare will devastate Medicaid and greatly weaken Medicare.  And it direct assaults essential reproductive healthcare for women.  Call your U.S. Senator today and tell them to VOTE NO.

More than 89,000 low-income Missouri seniors rely on Medicaid for their nursing home care.  TrumpCare would devastate Medicaid by slashing funding for this vital program by more than $700 billion...all to help fund a tax cut for the wealthiest Americans.  Republicans like to talk about family values.  That's not OK with my family...I bet not yours either.  CALL your US Senator and tell them to VOTE NO on TrumpCare.

There is no precedent for this un-American behavior within a presidential campaign.  If a foreign adversary offers you damaging information to harm your opponent, the only correct answer for a loyal citizen...call the FBI.  That didn't happen here, they welcomed the meeting.

POLITICO 7.11.17..."Donald Trump Jr. may have just given Robert Mueller “smoking gun” evidence signaling his father’s presidential campaign colluded with the Russian government to win the 2016 election, according to veteran prosecutors and white-collar defense attorneys experienced in Washington scandals."
NA

Proud that the U.S. House has passed H.R. 2480, bipartisan legislation that I was pleased to cosponsor with my friend and colleague from Missouri, Congresswoman Hartzler.  Sex trafficking is a 21st-century form of slavery,  Our bill will make it easier for local law enforcement to access federal resources needed to combat this heinous crime.  Please see video below.
ST. LOUIS POST-DISPATCH EDITORIAL 7.15.17 "This bill is not about freedom. It’s about greed."

So honored to help bring a $3 million federal investment back to the neighborhood where I grew up in North St. Louis to make the new Lacy Clay Center for Children's Health a reality.  Healing young people, stabilizing families, preserving their future.

How about resolving to not harm people and actually cover everyone.  Let's start here, open enrollment in Medicare plus private insurance for those who wish to purchase it.  Have cosponsored that legislation since 2001...time for a hearing!
A budget is a statement about your values...these aren't mine, I bet not yours either.
NA
NA
Time to tell the truth and get tough on Russia.

Very proud that the U.S. House has just passed my new, bipartisan legislation, H.R. 1927, the African American Civil Rights Network Act of 2017.  It's time to finally tell the largely untold story of the modern struggle for civil rights across this country.  My bill would help the National Park Service accomplish that.  A number of sites across the St. Louis region would be considered for inclusion on the national trail.  Special thanks to Congressman Jason Smith (R) Missouri, one of my principle co-sponsors. Not easy for a Democrat to pass legislation in the U.S. House, but we got it done today! Hope you enjoy the video below.
NA

Our brave troops deserve a Commander-in-Chief who thinks before he tweets...an outrageous and irresponsible insult to thousands of tremendous trans men and women who are serving their country with honor, courage and integrity around the world.
NA
Truly humbled to receive the National Urban League President's Award from Marc Morial at their magnificent annual conference in St. Louis.  Empowerment, energy, enthusiasm to Save Our Cities.

"A Justice Department spokeswoman said Arpaio faces up to six months in prison at his sentencing, which is scheduled for October 5."  Constitutional policing applies everywhere, and we should demand it.

Breaking up families by cutting immigration green cards in half will hurt our economy, cripple tourism, agriculture, and make us weaker, not stronger. This race-based, intolerant nonsense is not about protecting American workers. It's about blowing the race whistle when you're in trouble to fire up what's left of the President's base.  Shameful...and not what this country is all about.
Constitutional policing is essential...vast majority of good and dedicated police officers across the nation know that.  Too bad the President doesn't know and doesn't care.
There are lots of  Fergusons across America...and we are still demanding justice for all, instead of just for some.

Here's the thing...climate change is real, and it's a clear and present danger to our nation and the whole planet.  Science matters, so does clean energy.  That's why I've always supported federal investments to make America the world's renewable energy leader.  Jobs and clean energy go together.
Remembering Mike Brown and praying that the lessons from Ferguson will not be forgotten.  We still have much work to do.

It took President Trump three days to denounce the KKK and Neo-Nazis who did this...that's not leadership...its a grave moral failure and a lack of courage to speak out against the white supremacists who support him.  Sad, tragic, demeaning.
If we really want to stand up to hate and heal this country, telling the whole truth about the struggle for civil rights is essential to the process of reconciliation.
NA
It's time to stand up against hate, thanks to the St. Louis American for today's exceptional editorial.

Proud to help bring the new western headquarters of the National Geospatial Intelligence Agency to North St. Louis.  This $1.75 billion project is the largest federal investment in the history of the St. Louis region.  We are replacing a terrible federal failure (Pruitt-Igoe) with a spectacular and transformative federal success.

I have been blessed to know Dick Gregory since I was just a little boy.  Our families lived just a few blocks away from each other in North St. Louis.  Dick Gregory was a creative genius and a champion for justice, unrelenting in his demand for equality.  America has lost a national treasure, and my family has lost a good and dear friend.  Rest in power.
NA
From my fellow Missourian, former U.S. Senator Jack Danforth, an honorable public servant and a Republican who loves his country.
NA
NA

54-years ago today, my Dad, then Alderman Bill Clay and his brave coalition members from CORE at the Jefferson Bank standing up and going to jail to desegregate employment in St. Louis.  He proved that progress in civil rights requires courage, sacrifice and strategic discipline.  The power of nonviolence is truly transformative.

Once again, another young Black man dies at the hands of a police officer…with no consequences.  Jason Stockley acted as judge, jury and executioner. He violated multiple department regulations, and he showed a total disregard for the life of my constituent, Anthony Lamar Smith.  Justice has been cruelly denied for Anthony Lamar Smith’s family and this community.    I stand in total solidarity with them in expressing my absolute outrage at this verdict.  Our communities need and respect good policing.  A few bad apples denigrate the entire force and place officers and citizens unnecessarily in harm’s way when they meet.  We must demand changes in local law enforcement to ensure all lives are respected and honored. There is no coming back after a life is taken, only sadness.     Black Lives Matter, and that declaration is not meant to diminish or denigrate the value of any other group,  It is simply an honest statement of the ugly and very painful truth that in America, in 2017, some lives are still worth more than other lives.  Our young people are outraged and angry about that…and so am I. I  This tragic case also underscores the urgent, fundamental question that our nation, our state, and our community have thus far failed to honestly address…how do we transform local law enforcement and our criminal justice system to finally provide equal justice under the law for all…instead of just for some.  The federal legislation that I have already introduced could provide some of the answers because it would mandate increased sensitivity training for all police officers to help them deescalate potentially violent situations before they become deadly.   My bill also requires the appointment of an independent prosecutor in all instances when police use deadly force.    And my legislation incentivizes the use of body cameras by all local police departments who compete for Justice Department grants.    These transformative changes would make a huge difference in bridging the trust deficit that still divides many police officers from the citizens they are sworn to serve and protect.

The Republican tax scam passed today in the U.S. House betrays working families, explodes the debt, and punishes students, seniors, and homeowners.     It will raise taxes on 36 million middle-class families. It will bury student loan holders even deeper in debt by eliminating the deduction for student loan interest.
